I have been playing this game for many years and have spent thousands of dollars and hours playing on it. I have never wanted to quit LOL until now, I HATE the dynamic queue and if solo is not brought back I will be quiting league of legends the game I once loved.

The idea of a sandbox/training mode would be a good edition, as well as giving players a place to experiment and improve, it would also greatly benefit YouTubers and other content creators with a more flexible in-game framework to operate in; it could do wonders for the game's publicity and community.

As for Dynamic Queue (DQ), let's face it, playing alone will never be as fun as playing with friends. When partnered up with strangers, the chances are that at least one of them will troll you for some reason; that's not Riot's fault, it's an issue with all competitive online games. A randomised team will always be at a disadvantage against a pre-made team.

So, why not introduce a 1v1 queue alongside DQ?
 
That way players have  a way to pursue individual glory and improvement without having a trolls interfere with their experience, and a more constructing alternative to trolling if they are inclined to. This will give players a chance to improve and display their own individual skill, and having that outlet could improve their team experience in DQ because they will be more confident in their ability.  

This is all just my opinion though, it's your game Riot, I'm sure you'll do what you think is best for its development.

Trouble with a 1v1 queue is that then people would only play lane bullies in that game mode, and it wouldn't be the utopia that you think. it would just be an unhealthy game mode. League needs more than one player per team so that games can have diversity. Why else do you think we have 130 champions now? Because Riot wants us to have game diversity. The whole idea of League is to work together as a team to take down your opponents, not individual power. While individual power can sometimes determine a game's outcome, it is often not the deciding factor. Generally, it is the macro-play (team-fight/objective timing) rather than the micro-play (placement in skirmishes, csing, etc) that wins games, and macro-play is all about the team, not the individual. Without your team, you couldn't possibly win. Only once you play with a group of people, and actually make connections with them, to see through the screen and past the character, and realise that there is another person there, can you truly win. Because life isn't about the small victories and losses, it's about winning overall.

There are tips that show up when you first go into dynamic queue that explain the basic's, but after you hit level 30 you shouldn't be playing normal games if you want to get better at the game.

"you shouldn't be playing normal games if you want to get better at the game."
I'm sorry, but you shouldn't be playing ranked to 'get better'! What a freaking nightmare! 
This is what creates the toxicity in the damn game - inept and inexperienced players jumping straight into most competitive side of the bloody game without enough knowledge or experience to successfully play the game without being carried hard and seriously pissing off the people that then have to try their best to carry their deadweight to a win while the inexperienced player makes mistake after mistake and refuses to take any form of advice or do anything at all the resembles co-operative teamwork. 
I have friends on my friendslist all playing ranked and they range from B5 to Master Tier. One thing they all have in common is the willingness set their egos aside to get better at the game - to listen and learn, to teach and improve - each and every one of them. I have zero tolerance for people who won't take simple advice without getting defensive and calling the person trying to help them 'toxic' no matter how tactfully things are put to them.
Ranked isn't a practice mode sorry, it _is _ the definition of tryhard srs mode. Or at least it should be.
If you queue up for ranked and you are doing anything less than 'trying hard', that includes trying hard to _work with your team_, then unfortunately you're the poster child for trolls. 
It would be nice if people could be held back from playing ranked until they have a set amount of lvl30 wins under their belt, and conversely, it would also be nice if people could be banned from ranked (using the ingame reporting system we have now similar to chat restrictions and low priority queues) while still being allowed to play normals. 
Unless you are a smurf then please do everyone a favour, including yourself, and stay in normals to 'get better'. Once you do then - and only then - queue up for ranked.
